column4: [ HELP]  $depmod -a  command shows Could not open directory /lib/module/2.6.15-23-386.
(I've only 2.6.15-25-386 directory).
huh? even sudo depmod -a?
it sounds like you deleted something you shouldn't have
you can't. your kernel needs modules that match it's version. what does uname -r say?
that wont work I think. where are you chrooted to?
what are you trying to do?
you boot a live cd and try to depmod -a your installed linux system?
that wont work
you cannot depmod from a different kernel
I guess you can depmod a different kernel afterall then, if you specify the version
well maybe the modules are not loaded
you need the usb modules to load
you need to do it in the broken system
this just list's what's loaded on the live cd
it's not
you need to boot the broken system
if I boot the broken system directly, usb kbd/mouse will not be available. So I'm not sure what you mean?
I was thinking of using a different keyboard. if you don't have one make sure those module names are mentioned in /etc/modules
I'm using Dell 2.7G, it doesn't have PS/2 port but USB only, I'm using a USB-to-PS/2(2 port) adapter to link my kbd/mouse
I can use kbd in GRUB or Bios, but not not work in Ubuntu GUI
